verses.kjv: Now when he had ended all his sayings in the audience of the people, he entered into Capernaum.
verses.web: After he had finished speaking in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capernaum.
verses.ct: When Jesus had finished saying all of this to the crowd, he went to Capernaum.

verses.kjv: And a certain centurion’s servant, who was dear unto him, was sick, and ready to die.
verses.web: A certain centurion’s servant, who was dear to him, was sick and at the point of death.
verses.ct: There, a Roman centurion had a servant he valued deeply, but the servant was sick and close to death.

verses.kjv: And when he heard of Jesus, he sent unto him the elders of the Jews, beseeching him that he would come and heal his servant.
verses.web: When he heard about Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, asking him to come and save his servant.
verses.ct: When the centurion heard about Jesus, he sent some Jewish elders to him, asking Jesus to come and heal his servant.

verses.kjv: And when they came to Jesus, they besought him instantly, saying, That he was worthy for whom he should do this:
verses.web: When they came to Jesus, they begged him earnestly, saying, “He is worthy for you to do this for him,
verses.ct: They came to Jesus and pleaded with him urgently. "This man deserves your help," they said.

verses.kjv: For he loveth our nation, and he hath built us a synagogue.
verses.web: for he loves our nation, and he built our synagogue for us.”
verses.ct: "He loves our people, and he's the one who built our synagogue."

verses.kjv: Then Jesus went with them. And when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying unto him, Lord, trouble not thyself: for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof:
verses.web: Jesus went with them. When he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying to him, “Lord, don’t trouble yourself, for I am not worthy for you to come under my roof.
verses.ct: So Jesus went with them. But when he was getting close to the house, the centurion sent friends with a message: "Lord, don't go to the trouble. I'm not worthy to have you come into my home.

verses.kjv: Wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee: but say in a word, and my servant shall be healed.
verses.web: Therefore I didn’t even think myself worthy to come to you; but say the word, and my servant will be healed.
verses.ct: That's why I didn't even feel worthy to come to you myself. Just say the word, and my servant will be healed.

verses.kjv: For I also am a man set under authority, having under me soldiers, and I say unto one, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.
verses.web: For I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
verses.ct: I understand how authority works — I'm a man under authority myself, with soldiers under me. I tell one, 'Go,' and he goes. I tell another, 'Come,' and he comes. I tell my servant, 'Do this,' and he does it."

verses.kjv: When Jesus heard these things, he marvelled at him, and turned him about, and said unto the people that followed him, I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.
verses.web: When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turned and said to the multitude who followed him, “I tell you, I have not found such great faith, no, not in Israel.”
verses.ct: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed. He turned to the crowd following him and said, "I'm telling you, I haven't found faith this great anywhere in Israel."

verses.kjv: And they that were sent, returning to the house, found the servant whole that had been sick.
verses.web: Those who were sent, returning to the house, found that the servant who had been sick was well.
verses.ct: When the messengers returned to the house, they found the servant completely well.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass the day after, that he went into a city called Nain; and many of his disciples went with him, and much people.
verses.web: Soon afterwards, he went to a city called Nain. Many of his disciples, along with a great multitude, went with him.
verses.ct: The next day, Jesus traveled to a town called Nain. A large crowd and many of his disciples went along with him.

verses.kjv: Now when he came nigh to the gate of the city, behold, there was a dead man carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow: and much people of the city was with her.
verses.web: Now when he came near to the gate of the city, behold, one who was dead was carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. Many people of the city were with her.
verses.ct: As he approached the town gate, a funeral procession was coming out. The dead man was the only son of a widow, and a large crowd from the town was with her.

verses.kjv: And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her, Weep not.
verses.web: When the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said to her, “Don’t cry.”
verses.ct: When the Lord saw her, his heart broke for her. "Don't cry," he said.

verses.kjv: And he came and touched the bier: and they that bare him stood still. And he said, Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.
verses.web: He came near and touched the coffin, and the bearers stood still. He said, “Young man, I tell you, arise!”
verses.ct: Then he walked up and touched the coffin, and the men carrying it stopped. He said, "Young man, I tell you — get up!"

verses.kjv: And he that was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he delivered him to his mother.
verses.web: He who was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he gave him to his mother.
verses.ct: The dead man sat up and began to talk! Then Jesus gave him back to his mother.

verses.kjv: And there came a fear on all: and they glorified God, saying, That a great prophet is risen up among us; and, That God hath visited his people.
verses.web: Fear took hold of all, and they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet has arisen among us!” and, “God has visited his people!”
verses.ct: Everyone was gripped with fear, and they praised God. "A great prophet has risen among us!" they said. "God has come to help his people!"

verses.kjv: And this rumour of him went forth throughout all Judaea, and throughout all the region round about.
verses.web: This report went out concerning him in the whole of Judea, and in all the surrounding region.
verses.ct: News about Jesus spread throughout all of Judea and the entire surrounding region.

verses.kjv: And the disciples of John shewed him of all these things.
verses.web: The disciples of John told him about all these things.
verses.ct: John's disciples told him about everything that was happening.

verses.kjv: And John calling unto him two of his disciples sent them to Jesus, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?
verses.web: John, calling to himself two of his disciples, sent them to Jesus, saying, “Are you the one who is coming, or should we look for another?”
verses.ct: So John called 2 of his disciples and sent them to Jesus with this question: "Are you the one we've been waiting for, or should we be looking for someone else?"

verses.kjv: When the men were come unto him, they said, John Baptist hath sent us unto thee, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?
verses.web: When the men had come to him, they said, “John the Baptizer has sent us to you, saying, ‘Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?’ ”
verses.ct: When the men reached Jesus, they said, "John the Baptist sent us to ask you: 'Are you the one who is coming, or should we look for someone else?'"

verses.kjv: And in that same hour he cured many of their infirmities and plagues, and of evil spirits; and unto many that were blind he gave sight.
verses.web: In that hour he cured many of diseases and plagues and evil spirits; and to many who were blind he gave sight.
verses.ct: Right then and there, Jesus healed many people of diseases, afflictions, and evil spirits, and he restored sight to many who were blind.

verses.kjv: Then Jesus answering said unto them, Go your way, and tell John what things ye have seen and heard; how that the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, to the poor the gospel is preached.
verses.web: Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John the things which you have seen and heard: that the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.
verses.ct: Then Jesus told them, "Go back and report to John what you've seen and heard: the blind can see, the lame are walking, lepers are healed, the deaf can hear, the dead are being raised, and the good news is being preached to the poor.

verses.kjv: And blessed is he, whosoever shall not be offended in me.
verses.web: Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me.”
verses.ct: And blessed is the person who doesn't lose faith in me."

verses.kjv: And when the messengers of John were departed, he began to speak unto the people concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness for to see? A reed shaken with the wind?
verses.web: When John’s messengers had departed, he began to tell the multitudes about John, “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
verses.ct: After John's messengers left, Jesus began talking to the crowd about John. "What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A blade of grass swaying in the wind?

verses.kjv: But what went ye out for to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they which are gorgeously apparelled, and live delicately, are in kings’ courts.
verses.web: But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft clothing? Behold, those who are gorgeously dressed, and live delicately, are in kings’ courts.
verses.ct: Then what did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? People who wear expensive clothing and live in luxury are found in palaces.

verses.kjv: But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and much more than a prophet.
verses.web: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.
verses.ct: So what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes — and I tell you, he's far more than a prophet.

verses.kjv: This is he, of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.
verses.web: This is he of whom it is written, ‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’
verses.ct: He is the one Scripture talks about when it says, 'Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare the way before you.'

verses.kjv: For I say unto you, Among those that are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist: but he that is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.
verses.web: “For I tell you, among those who are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptizer, yet he who is least in God’s Kingdom is greater than he.”
verses.ct: I tell you, no one ever born is greater than John the Baptist. Yet even the least important person in the kingdom of God is greater than he is."

verses.kjv: And all the people that heard him, and the publicans, justified God, being baptized with the baptism of John.
verses.web: When all the people and the tax collectors heard this, they declared God to be just, having been baptized with John’s baptism.
verses.ct: When the common people and the tax collectors heard this, they acknowledged that God was right, since they had been baptized by John.

verses.kjv: But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God against themselves, being not baptized of him.
verses.web: But the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected the counsel of God, not being baptized by him themselves.
verses.ct: But the Pharisees and the experts in the law rejected God's purpose for them, because they had refused to be baptized by John.

verses.kjv: And the Lord said, Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation? and to what are they like?
verses.web: “To what then should I compare the people of this generation? What are they like?
verses.ct: "So what should I compare the people of this generation to? What are they like?

verses.kjv: They are like unto children sitting in the marketplace, and calling one to another, and saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned to you, and ye have not wept.
verses.web: They are like children who sit in the marketplace, and call to one another, saying, ‘We piped to you, and you didn’t dance. We mourned, and you didn’t weep.’
verses.ct: They're like children sitting in the marketplace calling out to each other: 'We played music for you, and you didn't dance! We sang a funeral song, and you didn't cry!'

verses.kjv: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine; and ye say, He hath a devil.
verses.web: For John the Baptizer came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’
verses.ct: John the Baptist came fasting — not eating bread or drinking wine — and you said, 'He has a demon.'

verses.kjv: The Son of man is come eating and drinking; and ye say, Behold a gluttonous man, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners!
verses.web: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man, and a drunkard; a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
verses.ct: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and you say, 'Look at him! A glutton and a drunk, hanging around with tax collectors and sinners!'

verses.kjv: But wisdom is justified of all her children.
verses.web: Wisdom is justified by all her children.”
verses.ct: But wisdom proves itself right by the lives of those who follow it."

verses.kjv: And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him. And he went into the Pharisee’s house, and sat down to meat.
verses.web: One of the Pharisees invited him to eat with him. He entered into the Pharisee’s house, and sat at the table.
verses.ct: One of the Pharisees invited Jesus to dinner. So Jesus went to his house and took his place at the table.

verses.kjv: And, behold, a woman in the city, which was a sinner, when she knew that Jesus sat at meat in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster box of ointment,
verses.web: Behold, a woman in the city who was a sinner, when she knew that he was reclining in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster jar of ointment.
verses.ct: A woman in that town who had lived a sinful life found out that Jesus was eating at the Pharisee's house. She brought an alabaster jar of perfumed ointment

verses.kjv: And stood at his feet behind him weeping, and began to wash his feet with tears, and did wipe them with the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.
verses.web: Standing behind at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears, and she wiped them with the hair of her head, kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.
verses.ct: and stood behind him at his feet, weeping. Her tears fell on his feet, and she wiped them with her hair, kissing his feet over and over and pouring the ointment on them.

verses.kjv: Now when the Pharisee which had bidden him saw it, he spake within himself, saying, This man, if he were a prophet, would have known who and what manner of woman this is that toucheth him: for she is a sinner.
verses.web: Now when the Pharisee who had invited him saw it, he said to himself, “This man, if he were a prophet, would have perceived who and what kind of woman this is who touches him, that she is a sinner.”
verses.ct: When the Pharisee who had invited Jesus saw this, he thought to himself, "If this man were really a prophet, he'd know what kind of woman is touching him. She's a sinner."

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering said unto him, Simon, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And he saith, Master, say on.
verses.web: Jesus answered him, “Simon, I have something to tell you.” He said, “Teacher, say on.”
verses.ct: Jesus spoke up. "Simon, I have something to tell you." "Go ahead, Teacher," Simon replied.

verses.kjv: There was a certain creditor which had two debtors: the one owed five hundred pence, and the other fifty.
verses.web: “A certain lender had two debtors. The one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.
verses.ct: "A moneylender had 2 people who owed him money. One owed 500 denarii, and the other owed 50.

verses.kjv: And when they had nothing to pay, he frankly forgave them both. Tell me therefore, which of them will love him most?
verses.web: When they couldn’t pay, he forgave them both. Which of them therefore will love him most?”
verses.ct: Neither of them could pay him back, so he forgave both debts. Now, which of them do you think will love him more?"

verses.kjv: Simon answered and said, I suppose that he, to whom he forgave most. And he said unto him, Thou hast rightly judged.
verses.web: Simon answered, “He, I suppose, to whom he forgave the most.” He said to him, “You have judged correctly.”
verses.ct: Simon answered, "I'd guess the one who had the bigger debt forgiven." Jesus said, "You're exactly right."

verses.kjv: And he turned to the woman, and said unto Simon, Seest thou this woman? I entered into thine house, thou gavest me no water for my feet: but she hath washed my feet with tears, and wiped them with the hairs of her head.
verses.web: Turning to the woman, he said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered into your house, and you gave me no water for my feet, but she has wet my feet with her tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head.
verses.ct: Then he turned toward the woman and said to Simon, "Do you see this woman? When I came into your house, you didn't offer me water to wash my feet. But she has washed my feet with her tears and dried them with her hair.

verses.kjv: Thou gavest me no kiss: but this woman since the time I came in hath not ceased to kiss my feet.
verses.web: You gave me no kiss, but she, since the time I came in, has not ceased to kiss my feet.
verses.ct: You didn't greet me with a kiss, but from the moment I walked in, she hasn't stopped kissing my feet.

verses.kjv: My head with oil thou didst not anoint: but this woman hath anointed my feet with ointment.
verses.web: You didn’t anoint my head with oil, but she has anointed my feet with ointment.
verses.ct: You didn't anoint my head with oil, but she has poured ointment on my feet.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I say unto thee, Her sins, which are many, are forgiven; for she loved much: but to whom little is forgiven, the same loveth little.
verses.web: Therefore I tell you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven, for she loved much. But one to whom little is forgiven, loves little.”
verses.ct: So I tell you, her many sins have been forgiven — and her great love proves it. But whoever has been forgiven only a little loves only a little."

verses.kjv: And he said unto her, Thy sins are forgiven.
verses.web: He said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”
verses.ct: Then Jesus said to her, "Your sins are forgiven."

verses.kjv: And they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves, Who is this that forgiveth sins also?
verses.web: Those who sat at the table with him began to say to themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”
verses.ct: The other guests began whispering to each other, "Who does he think he is, forgiving sins?"

verses.kjv: And he said to the woman, Thy faith hath saved thee; go in peace.
verses.web: He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”
verses.ct: But Jesus said to the woman, "Your faith has saved you. Go in peace."
